greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of partitions of a set of n elements where the partitions are of size > 3.
link: Seiichi Manyama, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..583 (terms 0..250 from Alois P. Heinz)
E. A. Enneking and J. C. Ahuja, Generalized Bell numbers, Fib. Quart., 14 (1976), 67-73.
I. Mezo, Periodicity of the last digits of some combinatorial sequences, arXiv preprint arXiv:1308.1637 [math.CO], 2013 and J. Int. Seq. 17 (2014) #14.1.1.
formula: a(0) = 1; a(n) = Sum_{k=4..n} binomial(n-1,k-1) * a(n-k). - _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Feb 09 2020
results.author: Steven C. Fairgrieve (fsteven(AT)math.wvu.edu), Nov 06 2000
ext: Corrected and extended by _Christian G. Bower_ and _James A. Sellers_, Nov 09 2000
